title: Bethlehems beauty, Londons charity, and the cities glory. A panegyrical poem on that magnificent structure, lately erected in Moorfields, vulgarly called New Bedlam. Humbly addrest to the honourable master, governours, and other noble benefactors of that splendid and most useful hospital.
publicationStmtPublisher: Printed for Thomas Sear [i.e. Sare] in Sweethins Ally near the Royal Exchange,
